name: Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act
summary: The GLBA requires financial institutions to explain their information-sharing practices to their customers and to safeguard sensitive data. The Safeguards Rule requires financial institutions to develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program.

articles.title: Standards for safeguarding customer information
articles.summary: Each financial institution must develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive written information security program that contains administrative, technical, and physical safeguards appropriate to the size and complexity of the institution.
articles.notes: The security program must be designed to ensure the security and confidentiality of customer information.

articles.title: Elements of information security program
articles.summary: The information security program must include: designation of an employee to coordinate the program, risk assessment, safeguards to control identified risks, service provider oversight, and program adjustments based on changes to operations or circumstances.
articles.notes: The program must be regularly reviewed and updated.

articles.title: Initial privacy notice
articles.summary: Financial institutions must provide customers with a clear and conspicuous initial privacy notice that explains the institution's information collection and sharing practices.
articles.notes: Privacy notices must be provided at the time of establishing a customer relationship.

articles.title: Annual privacy notice
articles.summary: Financial institutions must provide customers with an annual privacy notice that describes the institution's information collection and sharing practices and customers' right to opt-out of certain information sharing.
articles.notes: Annual notices must be clear and delivered in a manner that ensures customers receive them.

developer_guidance: Implement comprehensive information security programs covering administrative, technical, and physical safeguards
Conduct regular risk assessments to identify threats and vulnerabilities to customer information
Encrypt customer information both at rest and in transit using strong encryption
Implement access controls to ensure only authorized personnel can access customer information
Maintain audit logs of all access to customer information
Establish procedures for detecting, preventing, and responding to security incidents
Ensure service providers implement appropriate safeguards for customer information
Provide clear privacy notices explaining information collection and sharing practices
Implement mechanisms for customers to opt-out of certain information sharing
Regularly test and monitor security controls to ensure effectiveness
Train employees on information security policies and procedures
Establish incident response procedures for security breaches involving customer information
